issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/176113

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/176113

comment.body:
I didn't know that on MacOS there is no one filter editor for DNS filtering, but there are just blocklist and allowlist.
Please try to add this:
```adblock
cdn.tagcommander.com
```
to `allowlist` in DNS protection settings.

comment.body:
@AdamWr 
About this rule : @@||cdn.tagcommander.com^|
I have first remove it from user filter.

Then, I have disabled the DNS filtering. Result : it works (the next page is loading and I can access to my emails).
Is it a way to solve this problem for this site only (without disabling the DNS filtering for all sites) ?

To be honest, I have no idea about issue with Google.
Regarding `laposte.net`, I suppose that on once this request was unblocked, it has been cached and for some time it will be not blocked by DNS filtering.
After some time it will be blocked again and I guess that problem will reoccurs.

comment.body:
@AdamWr 
I have just made a test by removing this rule in DNS/Allow list : cdn.tagcommander.com

Then, as I had problems also with connecting to Google accoiunt on google home page, I gone in Safari/preferences and deleted all datas from all websites (cookies, etc ...).

Result : all is working well now : 
- the site La Poste is working (I can access to my emails)
- and also the google home page where I can connect again to my google account
- 
So, it seems that we don't have the need to put cdn.tagcommander.com  in DNS Allow list.

Do you understand why I needed to clean all datas from all websites  in order to solve the problem ?

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/176113

comment.body:
Перестало повторятся не известно, что повлияло. На компьютере и на мою.телефоне дзен стал хорошо грузиться с включенным https-фильтрацией02.05.2024, 19:12, "Alex" ***@***.***>:

Здравствуйте! На яндекс дзене постоянно грузит (скрин во вложении) Знаю в чем проблема, а проблема с включенным https-фильтрацией. Началось с 26.04.24 примерно 16:00. До это этого с https-фильтрацией проблем не было версия adguard таже не менялась. Что произошло не понятно. Если отключаю фильтрацию то соответственно начинаются появляться рекламы

Не повторяется. Предудущие аналгичные жалобы тоже.
Ещё повторяется? Не забудьте включить фильтрацию HTTPS.

pull_request.title: Add a rule for qidian.com
pull_request.body:
A script on www.qidian.com is consuming CPU and appears to be non-functional. This PR blocks it.

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

This script from Qidian consumes user's CPU and appears to provide no actual functionality. This slows down the user's browser. I suspect that this script is either a mining script or an anti-ad blocker measure.

### Enter the issue address

[#178228](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178228)

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

This can be confirmed both on Firefox and Chromium. Blocking this script does not affect website functionality. I tested the basic login and reading (this is a novel website) functions, and everything seems to be working fine.

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29907700/c8efc467-80e1-4f8a-9810-e100f9975b72)

The script is obfuscated and makes a large number of recursive function calls. This can be confirmed using the browser's performance profiler.

</details>

<details>


### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: A script on www.qidian.com is consuming CPU and appears to be non-functional
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension, Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBlock Origin 1.57.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

Desktop

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. This script from Qidian consumes user's CPU and appears to provide no actual functionality. This slows down the user's browser. I suspect that this script is either a mining script or an anti-ad blocker measure. This is confirmed both on Firefox and Chromium.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29907700/c8efc467-80e1-4f8a-9810-e100f9975b72)

The script is obfuscated and makes a large number of recursive function calls. This can be confirmed using the browser's performance profiler.

</details>



### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

@ImBearChild Hi.
Probably it is used for site security.

Please try to block `qidian.com/C2WF946J0/probev3.js` in user rules.

I found some info about this script, but translation from Chinese is unclear for me:
https://www.52pojie.cn/thread-1916130-1-1.html

1. <comment>
Browser: Firefox mobile 124.2.0

Ublock origin version: 1.57.0

Android version: miui 14.0.13.0.TKOEUVF

Hello. While I scroll Facebook home in the browser often it goes back enough to send to the previous post I've seen. It does the reverse thing if I try to scroll back, jumping forth. Disabling adguard mobile ads filter this behaviour stops.

Looks like its related to ads not being shown but not correctly handled, I could be wrong though.

comment.body:
@dalisoft А ещё повторяется? Сейчас не наблюдаю `stream.voidboost.cc` в запросах.

`@@||stream.voidboost.top^$domain=rezka.ag` на антитрекинг не должно было повлиять, т.к. нет модификатора `$stealth`.
Но в Базовом фильтре есть исключение `@@||stream.voidboost.cc^$stealth`, которое решает проблему с Антитрекингом, о которой вы сообщали пару лет назад https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/127656#issuecomment-1227726814

`AdGuard Tracking filter` домен не затрагивает. Не сохранился адрес, который был заблокирован?
